intro: Teijsmanniodendron pteropodum f. auriculatum, commonly known as the golden ear tree, is a unique variant of the original species. It is characterized by its distinctive auriculate (ear-shaped) leaves, which give it its common name. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical features of this plant make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and pharmacological study.
